channel.title: I have a question about serverfile.bat
channel.description: this is a compile and auto runserv isnt it?

item.title: I have a question about serverfile.bat
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

lol ok ill cheak this out thanks :D[br][size=1]Posted on: July 03, 2007, 01:43:07 PM[/size][hr]ok that brought it back to normal and this is what i get

This code is made by Pizza Pie! 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Starting Hippiescape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594

how do i make the compiler work on this…lol[br][size=1]Posted on: July 03, 2007, 01:44:55 PM[/size][hr]wait… is it posible to set the compile part of my compiler to this? ---- edit ---- nvm that was a bad idea

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question about serverfile.bat

item.title: I have a question about serverfile.bat
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

actually jsut do this:, inside of your serverfile.bat, paste this code in there:

@echo off
echo This code is made by Pizza Pie!
javac *.java
[runserver.bat code]

now, replace “[runserver.bat code]” with everything from your runserver right after “@echo off”

Read full topic

item.title: I have a question about serverfile.bat
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

well… my compiler works fine, i dont want it changed… i tried puting the runserv into
serverfile.bat… that didnt work so well…

i put the perfect compiler in the server.bat… cuz i was a stupid noob… i deleted the auto compile and run part… i remember the compile part didnt work so like… i can probably redownload the source i had ( pimpscape ) and replace it… but then the compile part wont work again… could u fix that if i tried it? once again i love the idea of a working auto compile and run
